result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean Bernier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt - Max Penalty Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  Repeater enhancer is dismissed.

**CORRECTED** 3-2-16 Modifier added to show Attempted Possession, per Court Order.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean Bernier

records.addlTxt: Responsive letter from the Court to the defendant denying expungement

Letter from defendant requesting expungement.
Pursuant to the Supreme Court's Order issued 4-13-20, this document is deemed filed 10-28-20 because that is the date it was mailed.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Two discharge certificates filed by DOC
Defendant's probation terminated on 4-10-17; unpaid supervision fees of $40
Order to correct JOC to add modifier of attemped possession of a narcotic drug.
reply from State to request to correct JOC - state took no position
Letter from Attorney J. Steven House requesting an amendment to the JOC

Defendant Sean Bernier in court with attorney J. Steven House.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead guilty on Ct. 1 of information, with second offense enhancer removed.  Court accepted plea and found defendant guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court dismissed the enhancer.  Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation are submit DNA sample.  $518.00 costs.  AODA and comply.  No jail credit.

Defendant Sean Bernier in court with attorney J. Steven House.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty pleas.  Atty House requested a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Sean Bernier in court with attorney J. Steven House.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   New pretrial and return date requested by Atty House.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 29, 2014 at 01:50 pm.  Hearing scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by ADA Yaskal
